alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 06 at 7:47PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern Delaware, including the following county, New Castle. Portions of southeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Chester and Delaware. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 744 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicates that rain has largely moved out of the area. However, radar estimates and automated rain gauges indicate between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Therefore, minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Elam, Talleyville, and Greenville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
